English: Now in the first year of Cyrus king of Persia, that the word of the LORD by the mouth of Jeremiah might be fulfilled, the LORD stirred up the spirit of Cyrus king of Persia, so that he made a proclamation throughout all his kingdom, and also put it in writing, saying
Bahnar: Sơnăm blŭng-a lăm chăl Sirus, pơtao pơgơ̆r dêh char Phersia, Kră Yang wă pơsĭt nơ̆r Sư đei yua 'bơ̆r Jêrêmi đei khan, na Sư pơm ăn kơ jơhngơ̆m Sirus, pơtao Phersia ră roi jơ̆p-jang kơ teh đak sư kơdih păng kư̆m đei chih hla bơar tơjur nơ̆r sư thoi âu

English: Thus says Cyrus king of Persia: All the kingdoms of the earth the LORD God of heaven has given me. And He has commanded me to build Him a house at Jerusalem which is in Judah.
Bahnar: Sirus pơtao Phersia, khan thoi âu: Kră Yang Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đei ăn kơ inh pơgơ̆r dôm lu dêh char lăm teh đak păng kơdih Sư athei inh pơm kơ Sư minh pôm hnam akŭm tơ pơlei Jêrusalem, lăm dêh Juđa.

English: Who is among you of all His people? May his God be with him, and let him go up to Jerusalem which is in Judah, and build the house of the LORD God of Israel (He is God), which is in Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu lăm lu iĕm, mă kon pơlei Sư, athei wih brŏka tơ pơlei Jêrusalem dêh Juđa, wă pơm ming dơ̆ng hnam akŭm Kră Yang, Sư boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơngai Isơrael, mă oei lăm pơlei Jêrusalem. Hơpơi kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei bơngai noh oei hơdai hăm sư!

English: And whoever is left in any place where he dwells, let the men of his place help him with silver and gold, with goods and livestock, besides the freewill offerings for the house of God which is in Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Juđa mă oei arih, mă khan oei tơ yơ, kon pơlei mă tơ anih lu sư oei, athei tơgŭm lu sư hu, maih, mŭk tơmam, sem dơrong, wă pơm hnam akŭm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, ưh kơ jô̆ lu tơmam đei pơyơ̆r boih tơ lăm hnam akŭm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: Then the heads of the fathers’ houses of Judah and Benjamin, and the priests and the Levites, with all whose spirits God had moved, arose to go up and build the house of the LORD which is in Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh, lu kơdră adrĕch Juđa păng Bênjamin, lu 'bok soi păng bơngai Lêwi, đĭ-đăng dôm lu đe bu mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đei pơtrŭt lăm jơhngơ̆m lu sư wă, năm pơjing hnam akŭm Kră Yang tơ pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: And all those who were around them encouraged them with articles of silver and gold, with goods and livestock, and with precious things, besides all that was willingly offered.
Bahnar: Lu kon pơlei oei lăm tơring ei lu sư tơgŭm tơmam ngăl, ăn kơ lu sư tơmam păng hu păng maih, mŭk tơmam, sem dơrong păng dôm lu tơmam gĭt, ưh kơ jô̆ lu tơmam mă đe đei pơyơ̆r nai.

English: King Cyrus also brought out the articles of the house of the LORD, which Nebuchadnezzar had taken from Jerusalem and put in the temple of his gods
Bahnar: Pơtao Sirus kư̆m pơdrâu dôm lu tơmam yua lăm hnam akŭm Kră Yang, mă đêl Nebukatnessar đei iŏk đơ̆ng pơlei Jêrusalem păng tah 'măn lăm hnam yang sư.

English: and Cyrus king of Persia brought them out by the hand of Mithredath the treasurer, and counted them out to Sheshbazzar the prince of Judah.
Bahnar: Sirus, pơtao Phersia, athei Mitrêdat, bơngai wei tơmam, iŏk lu tơmam yua lăm hnam akŭm tơlĕch đĭ tơ 'nguaih, jô̆ păng pơjao kơ Sêsbasar kuan tih lăm dêh Juđa.

English: This is the number of them: thirty gold platters, one thousand silver platters, twenty-nine knives
Bahnar: 'Nâu kơsô̆ lu tơmam yua lăm hnam akŭm ei: Pêng-jĭt tŏ pơnhan chhĕr maih, minh-rơbâu tŏ kơthao hu, 'bar-jĭt tơsĭn tŏ săng

English: thirty gold basins, four hundred and ten silver basins of a similar kind, and one thousand other articles.
Bahnar: pêng-jĭt hlak pơnhan maih, puăn-hrĕng mơjĭt hlak pơnhan hu, lei-lăi, minh-rơbâu tŏ tơmam yua nai dơ̆ng.

English: All the articles of gold and silver were five thousand four hundred. All these Sheshbazzar took with the captives who were brought from Babylon to Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Jô̆ đĭ-đăng kơsô̆ tơmam yua lăm hnam akŭm mă đe pơm păng hu păng maih ei pơđăm-rơbâu puăn-hrĕng tŏ. Kơplah lu bơngai Isơrael đe rôp pơm bơnă oei tơ Babilôn đei chông wih brŏk tơ pơlei Jêrusalem, na Sêsbasar kư̆m chĕp ba hloi dôm lu tơmam ei.

English: Now these are the people of the province who came back from the captivity, of those who had been carried away, whom Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon had carried away to Babylon, and who returned to Jerusalem and Judah, everyone to his own city.
Bahnar: Lăm lu kon sâu tơring Juđa mă pơtao Nebukatnessar rôp chông ba tơ dêh char Babilôn, lu bơngai đe chông ei wih brŏk tơ pơlei Jêrusalem păng dêh Juđa, rim 'nu brŏk tơ pơlei sư kơdih

English: Those who came with Zerubbabel were Jeshua, Nehemiah, Seraiah, Reelaiah, Mordecai, Bilshan, Mispar, Bigvai, Rehum, and Baanah. The number of the men of the people of Israel
Bahnar: lu yŏng pơgơ̆r đei đe Serubabel, Jêsua, Nêhêmi, Sêraia, Rêlaia, Mordêkai, Bilsan, Mitpar, Bikwai, Rêhum păng Baanah chông wih brŏk. 'Nâu chih jô̆ lu kon drŏ-nglo Isơrael.

English: the people of Parosh, two thousand one hundred and seventy-two
Bahnar: Adrĕch adrung Pharôt, 'bar-rơbâu minh-hrĕng tơpơh-jĭt 'bar

English: the people of Shephatiah, three hundred and seventy-two
Bahnar: adrĕch Sêphatia, pêng-hrĕng tơpơh-jĭt 'bar

English: the people of Arah, seven hundred and seventy-five
Bahnar: adrĕch Arah tơpơh-hrĕng tơpơh-jĭt pơđăm

English: the people of Pahath-Moab, of the people of Jeshua and Joab, two thousand eight hundred and twelve
Bahnar: adrĕch Phahat Môap đei kon sâu Jêsua păng kon sâu Jôap 'bar-rơbâu tơhngam-hrĕng mơjĭt-'bar

English: the people of Elam, one thousand two hundred and fifty-four
Bahnar: adrĕch Êlam, minh-rơbâu 'bar-hrĕng pơđăm-jĭt puăn

English: the people of Zattu, nine hundred and forty-five
Bahnar: adrĕch Satu, tơsĭn-hrĕng puăn-jĭt pơđăm

English: the people of Zaccai, seven hundred and sixty
Bahnar: adrĕch Sakai, tơpơh-hrĕng tơdrâu-jĭt

English: the people of Bani, six hundred and forty-two
Bahnar: adrĕch Bani, tơdrâu-hrĕng puăn-jĭt 'bar

English: the people of Bebai, six hundred and twenty-three
Bahnar: adrĕch Bêbai, tơdrâu-hrĕng 'bar-jĭt pêng

English: the people of Azgad, one thousand two hundred and twenty-two
Bahnar: adrĕch Agat, minh-rơbâu 'bar-hrĕng 'bar-jĭt 'bar

English: the people of Adonikam, six hundred and sixty-six
Bahnar: adrĕch Ađônikam, tơdrâu-hrĕng tơdrâu-jĭt tơdrâu

English: the people of Bigvai, two thousand and fifty-six
Bahnar: adrĕch Bikwai, 'bar-rơbâu pơđăm-jĭt tơdrâu

English: the people of Adin, four hundred and fifty-four
Bahnar: adrĕch Adin, puăn-hrĕng pơđăm-jĭt puăn

English: the people of Ater of Hezekiah, ninety-eight
Bahnar: adrĕch Ater, gah hnam dơnŏ Hesekia, tơsĭn-jĭt tơhngam

English: the people of Bezai, three hundred and twenty-three
Bahnar: adrĕch Bêsai pêng-hrĕng 'bar-jĭt pêng

English: the people of Jorah, one hundred and twelve
Bahnar: adrĕch Jôra, minh-hrĕng jĭt 'bar

English: the people of Hashum, two hundred and twenty-three
Bahnar: adrĕch Hasum, 'bar-hrĕng 'bar-jĭt pêng

English: the people of Gibbar, ninety-five
Bahnar: adrĕch Gibar, tơsĭn-jĭt pơđăm.

English: the people of Bethlehem, one hundred and twenty-three
Bahnar: Bơngai pơlei Betlehem, minh-hrĕng 'bar-jĭt pêng

English: the men of Netophah, fifty-six
Bahnar: bơngai pơlei Nêtôpha, pơđăm-jĭt tơdrâu

English: the men of Anathoth, one hundred and twenty-eight
Bahnar: bơngai pơlei Anahôt, minh-hrĕng 'bar-jĭt tơhngam

English: the people of Azmaveth, forty-two
Bahnar: bơngai pơlei Asmawet, puăn-jĭt 'bar

English: the people of Kirjath Arim, Chephirah, and Beeroth, seven hundred and forty-three
Bahnar: bơngai pơlei Kiriat Jirim, Kêphira păng pơlei Bêrôt tơpơh-hrĕng puăn-jĭt pêng

English: the people of Ramah and Geba, six hundred and twenty-one
Bahnar: bơngai pơlei Rama păng Gêba, tơdrâu-hrĕng 'bar-jĭt mônh

English: the men of Michmas, one hundred and twenty-two
Bahnar: bơngai pơlei Mikma, minh-hrĕng 'bar-jĭt 'bar

English: the men of Bethel and Ai, two hundred and twenty-three
Bahnar: bơngai pơlei Bethel păng Ahi, 'bar-hrĕng 'bar-jĭt pêng

English: the people of Nebo, fifty-two
Bahnar: bơngai pơlei Nêbô, pơđăm-jĭt 'bar

English: the people of Magbish, one hundred and fifty-six
Bahnar: bơngai pơlei Makbi, minh-hrĕng pơđăm-jĭt tơdrâu

English: the people of the other Elam, one thousand two hundred and fifty-four
Bahnar: bơngai pơlei Êlam nai, minh-rơbâu 'bar-hrĕng pơđăm-jĭt puăn

English: the people of Harim, three hundred and twenty
Bahnar: bơngai pơlei Harim, pêng-hrĕng 'bar-jĭt

English: the people of Lod, Hadid, and Ono, seven hundred and twenty-five
Bahnar: bơngai pơlei Lôt, Hađit păng pơlei Ônô tơpơh-hrĕng 'bar-jĭt pơđăm

English: the people of Jericho, three hundred and forty-five
Bahnar: bơngai pơlei Jêrikô, pêng-hrĕng puăn-jĭt pơđăm

English: the people of Senaah, three thousand six hundred and thirty.
Bahnar: bơngai pơlei Sêna, pêng-rơbâu tơdrâu-hrĕng pêng-jĭt.

English: The priests: the sons of Jedaiah, of the house of Jeshua, nine hundred and seventy-three
Bahnar: Lu 'bok soi: Adrĕch Jêđaia, lăm hnam dơnŏ Jêsua, tơsĭn-hrĕng tơpơh-jĭt pêng

English: the sons of Immer, one thousand and fifty-two
Bahnar: adrĕch Imer, minh-rơbâu pơđăm-jĭt 'bar

English: the sons of Pashhur, one thousand two hundred and forty-seven
Bahnar: adrĕch Phasur, minh-rơbâu 'bar-hrĕng puăn-jĭt tơpơh

English: the sons of Harim, one thousand and seventeen.
Bahnar: adrĕch Harim, minh-rơbâu mơjĭt-tơpơh.

English: The Levites: the sons of Jeshua and Kadmiel, of the sons of Hodaviah, seventy-four.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Lêwi: Adrĕch Jôsua păng Katmiêl, kon sâu Hôđawia tơpơh-jĭt puăn.

English: The singers: the sons of Asaph, one hundred and twenty-eight.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai hơri: Adrĕch Asap, minh-hrĕng 'bar-jĭt tơhngam.

English: The sons of the gatekeepers: the sons of Shallum, the sons of Ater, the sons of Talmon, the sons of Akkub, the sons of Hatita, and the sons of Shobai, one hundred and thirty-nine in all.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai wei 'măng jang Hnam akŭm. Noh kon sâu Sallum, kon sâu Ater, kon sâu Tamôn, kon sâu Akup, kon sâu Hatita, kon sâu Sôbai, akŭm đĭ-đăng minh-hrĕng pêng-jĭt tơsĭn 'nu.

English: The Nethinim: the sons of Ziha, the sons of Hasupha, the sons of Tabbaoth
Bahnar: Lu bơngai awih awăn lăm Hnam akŭm: Kon sâu Siha, kon sâu Hasupha, kon sâu Tabaôt

English: the sons of Keros, the sons of Siaha, the sons of Padon
Bahnar: kon sâu Kêrôt, kon sâu Siaha, kon sâu Pađôn

English: the sons of Lebanah, the sons of Hagabah, the sons of Akkub
Bahnar: kon sâu Lêbana, kon sâu Hagaba, kon sâu Akup

English: the sons of Hagab, the sons of Shalmai, the sons of Hanan
Bahnar: kon sâu Hagap, kon sâu Salmai, kon sâu Hanan

English: the sons of Giddel, the sons of Gahar, the sons of Reaiah
Bahnar: kon sâu Giđêl, kon sâu Gahar, kon sâu Rêaia

English: the sons of Rezin, the sons of Nekoda, the sons of Gazzam
Bahnar: kon sâu Rêsin, kon sâu Nêkôđan kon sâu Gasam

English: the sons of Uzza, the sons of Paseah, the sons of Besai
Bahnar: kon sâu Usa, kon sâu Phasêa, kon sâu Bêsai

English: the sons of Asnah, the sons of Meunim, the sons of Nephusim
Bahnar: kon sâu Asêna, kon sâu Mêunim, kon sâu Nêphusim

English: the sons of Bakbuk, the sons of Hakupha, the sons of Harhur
Bahnar: kon sâu Bakbuk, kon sâu Hakupha, kon sâu Hahur

English: the sons of Bazluth, the sons of Mehida, the sons of Harsha
Bahnar: kon sâu Balut, kon sâu Mêhiđa, kon sâu Harsa

English: the sons of Barkos, the sons of Sisera, the sons of Tamah
Bahnar: kon sâu Barkô, Sisêra, Thômah

English: the sons of Neziah, and the sons of Hatipha.
Bahnar: kon sâu Nêsia, Hatipha.

English: The sons of Solomon’s servants: the sons of Sotai, the sons of Sophereth, the sons of Peruda
Bahnar: Kon sâu lu đĭch đam Sôlômôn: Kon sâu Sôtai, kon sâu Hasôphêrêt, kon sâu Phêruđa

English: the sons of Jaala, the sons of Darkon, the sons of Giddel
Bahnar: kon sâu Jaala, Darkôn, kon sâu Giđêl

English: the sons of Shephatiah, the sons of Hattil, the sons of Pochereth of Zebaim, and the sons of Ami.
Bahnar: kon sâu Sêphatia, kon sâu Hatil, kon sâu Pôkêrêt, kon sâu Hasêbaim păng kon sâu Ami.

English: All the Nethinim and the children of Solomon’s servants were three hundred and ninety-two.
Bahnar: Akŭm dôm lu bơngai awih awăn lăm hnam akŭm păng lu kon sâu lu đĭch đam Sôlômôn, đĭ-đăng pêng-hrĕng tơsĭn-jĭt 'bar 'nu.

English: And these were the ones who came up from Tel Melah, Tel Harsha, Cherub, Addan, and Immer; but they could not identify their father’s house or their genealogy, whether they were of Israel
Bahnar: 'Nâu jơ̆ lu bơngai oei tơ lăm pơlei Tênmêla. Têlatsa, Kêrup, Ađôn păng Immer wih brŏk tơ pơlei Jêrusalem, ưh pă đei roi hơđăl lu oei lăm adrĕch bơngai Isơrael dah ưh

English: the sons of Delaiah, the sons of Tobiah, and the sons of Nekoda, six hundred and fifty-two
Bahnar: Kon sâu Đêlaia kon sâu Tôbia, kon sâu Nêkôđa, đĭ-đăng tơdrâu-hrĕng pơđăm-jĭt 'bar 'nu.

English: and of the sons of the priests: the sons of Habaiah, the sons of Koz, and the sons of Barzillai, who took a wife of the daughters of Barzillai the Gileadite, and was called by their name.
Bahnar: Lăm adrĕch adrung 'bok soi: Kon sâu Habaia, kon sâu Hakkôs, kon sâu Barsilai (bơngai 'nâu oei kơ kon adruh Barsilai bơngai Gileat, na krao anăn sư thoi ei).

English: These sought their listing among those who were registered by genealogy, but they were not found; therefore they were excluded from the priesthood as defiled.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai noh chă adrĕch adrung lu sư ră mă-lei ưh kơ đei; na đe jô̆ lu sư ưh kơ rơgoh na păng tơlĕch lu sư đơ̆ng tơdrong jang 'bok soi.

English: And the governor said to them that they should not eat of the most holy things till a priest could consult with the Urim and Thummim.
Bahnar: 'Bok pơgơ̆r ưh kơ ăn lu sư sa tơmam rơgoh 'lơ̆ng tôch bơneh wă gô dĭng truh tơ layơ đei 'bok soi yua Urim păng Thumim mă krao apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei. Wă kơ băt lu sư hăm trŏ kơ adrĕch 'bok soi ưh.

English: The whole assembly together was forty-two thousand three hundred and sixty
Bahnar: Jô̆ đĭ-đăng kon pơlei đei puăn-jĭt 'bar-rơbâu pêng-hrĕng tơdrâu-jĭt 'nu

English: besides their male and female servants, of whom there were seven thousand three hundred and thirty-seven; and they had two hundred men and women singers.
Bahnar: ưh kơ jô̆ lu đĭch đam mă drŏ-nglo mă drŏ-kăn; kơsô̆ lu sư noh tơpơh-rơbâu pêng-hrĕng pêng-jĭt tơpơh kư̆m đei 'bar-hrĕng 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo drŏ-kăn hơri kiơ̆ lu sư mơ̆n.

English: Their horses were seven hundred and thirty-six, their mules two hundred and forty-five
Bahnar: Lu sư đei tơpơh-hrĕng pêng-jĭt tơdrâu tŏ aseh, 'bar-hrĕng puăn-jĭt pơđăm tŏ aseh lai.

English: their camels four hundred and thirty-five, and their donkeys six thousand seven hundred and twenty.
Bahnar: Puăn-hrĕng pêng-jĭt pơđăm tŏ aseh lăk-đa păng tơdrâu-rơbâu tơpơh-hrĕng 'bar-jĭt tŏ aseh iĕ.

English: Some of the heads of the fathers’ houses, when they came to the house of the LORD which is in Jerusalem, offered freely for the house of God, to erect it in its place
Bahnar: Đei lu kră kơdră lăm adrĕch adrung kơplah lu sư năm truh boih tơ hnam akŭm Kră Yang tơ pơlei Jêrusalem, na pơyơ̆r tơmam lu sư đei păng lăp đon lăm hnam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, wă pơdơ̆ng pơm ming 'bơ̆t anih so.

English: According to their ability, they gave to the treasury for the work sixty-one thousand gold drachmas, five thousand minas of silver, and one hundred priestly garments.
Bahnar: Kiơ̆ kơ kĕ đei lu sư kơdih pơyơ̆r 'măn tơ lăm hnam mong tơmam wă pơm hnam akŭm đei tơdrâu-jĭt mônh rơbâu đariêka maih pơđăm-rơbâu minab hu păng minh-hrĕng blah hơbĕn ao 'bok soi.

English: So the priests and the Levites, some of the people, the singers, the gatekeepers, and the Nethinim, dwelt in their cities, and all Israel in their cities.
Bahnar: Thoi noh dôm lu 'bok soi, lu bơngai Lêwi, dôm lu kon pơlei, lu bơngai hơri, lu bơngai wei 'măng, lu bơngai awih awăn lăm hnam akŭm păng đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael, nai kư̆m oei tơ lăm pơlei sư kơdih.

English: And when the seventh month had come, and the children of Israel were in the cities, the people gathered together as one man to Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Truh khei tơpơh, kơplah kon pơlei Isơrael hlôi oei lăm pơlei sư kơdih boih, na kon pơlei akŭm băl minh pôm đon nhen thoi minh 'nu bơngai lăm pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: Then Jeshua the son of Jozadak and his brethren the priests, and Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel and his brethren, arose and built the altar of the God of Israel, to offer burnt offerings on it, as it is written in the Law of Moses the man of God.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh, Jêsua, kon drŏ-nglo Jôsađăk păng lu 'bok soi hăm Serubabel, kon drŏ-nglo Sêathiel păng lu 'nhŏng oh sư, đĭ-đăng wang iung pơdơ̆ng chơnang soi Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đe Isơrael, wă pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh tơ noh, kiơ̆ kơ đei chih lăm hla bơar khôi juăt Môis, bơngai Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Though fear had come upon them because of the people of those countries, they set the altar on its bases; and they offered burnt offerings on it to the LORD, both the morning and evening burnt offerings.
Bahnar: Lu sư hli kơ kon pơlei kơtă, mă-lei pơm ming chơnang soi tơ hơnă so sư păng soi pơyơ̆r tơmam soi kơ Kră Yang tơ noh, wă khan tơmam soi 'buh gah pơgê păng kơsơ̆.

English: They also kept the Feast of Tabernacles, as it is written, and offered the daily burnt offerings in the number required by ordinance for each day.
Bahnar: Lu sư kư̆m bơwei giĕng bơsŭn, kiơ̆ thoi đei chih păng soi pơyơ̆r lu tơmam soi 'buh, kiơ̆ kơ đei hơgăt kơ rim năr.

English: Afterwards they offered the regular burnt offering, and those for New Moons and for all the appointed feasts of the LORD that were consecrated, and those of everyone who willingly offered a freewill offering to the LORD.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh, lu sư soi pơyơ̆r lu tơmam soi 'buh ling-lang, pơyơ̆r lu tơmam soi 'bơ̆t khei tơ'bang păng pơyơ̆r tơmam soi lăm lu năr giĕng tih 'măn năr 'lơ̆ng rơgoh kơ Kră Yang; kư̆m pơyơ̆r lu tơmam soi kiơ̆ kơ rim 'nu đei pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang.

English: From the first day of the seventh month they began to offer burnt offerings to the LORD, although the foundation of the temple of the LORD had not been laid.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng năr mă mônh khei tơpơh, lu sư pơtơm soi pơyơ̆r lu tơmam soi 'buh ăn kơ Kră Yang; mă-lei ưh tam mă man hơnă hnam akŭm Kră Yang Pơm Hnam Akŭm.

English: They also gave money to the masons and the carpenters, and food, drink, and oil to the people of Sidon and Tyre to bring cedar logs from Lebanon to the sea, to Joppa, according to the permission which they had from Cyrus king of Persia.
Bahnar: Lu sư asong ăn jên kơ lu bơngai gơh blah tơmo man păng lu bơngai gơh jang 'long păng ăn lu tơmam sa, đak nhă păng đak rơmă ăn kơ kon pơlei Siđôn păng kon pơlei Tirơ wă wơh lu sư chă 'long hơngo đơ̆ng Liban dui trong đak dơsĭ truh tơ Jôpa, đơ̆ng chơ truh tơ pơlei Jêrusalem kiơ̆ kơ Sirus pơtao đe Phersia đei tơjur athei.

English: Now in the second month of the second year of their coming to the house of God at Jerusalem, Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, Jeshua the son of Jozadak, and the rest of their brethren the priests and the Levites, and all those who had come out of the captivity to Jerusalem, began work and appointed the Levites from twenty years old and above to oversee the work of the house of the LORD.
Bahnar: Sơnăm mă 'bar khei 'bar, đơ̆ng rŏng lu sư brŏk tơ hnam akŭm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ pơlei Jêrusalem, Serubabel, kon drŏ-nglo Sêathiel păng Jêsua kon drŏ-nglo Jôsađăk, lu 'nhŏng oh, lu 'bok soi păng bơngai Lêwi, hăm đĭ-đăng lu bơngai mă đe rôp pơm bơnă 'nao wih brŏk tơ pơlei Jêrusalem, đĭ-đăng wang pơtơm pơm pơjing hnam akŭm; Lu sư ăn bơngai Lêwi đơ̆ng 'bar-jĭt sơnăm năm tơ kơpal, wă kơ wei-lăng tơdrong jang pơm pơjing hnam akŭm Kră Yang.

English: Then Jeshua with his sons and brothers, Kadmiel with his sons, and the sons of Judah, arose as one to oversee those working on the house of God: the sons of Henadad with their sons and their brethren the Levites.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh, Jêsua, lu kon drŏ-nglo sư păng lu 'nhŏng oh sư Katmiêl păng lu kon drŏ-nglo sư, lu kon sâu Hađawia păng lu kon drŏ-nglo Hênadat, kon sâu păng 'nhŏng oh lu sư, đĭ-đăng lu sư bơngai Lêwi akŭm băl minh jơhngơ̆m đon nhen thoi minh 'nu bơngai, na wei-lăng lu bơngai bơ̆jang pơm hnam akŭm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: When the builders laid the foundation of the temple of the LORD, the priests stood in their apparel with trumpets, and the Levites, the sons of Asaph, with cymbals, to praise the LORD, according to the ordinance of David king of Israel.
Bahnar: Kơplah lu bơngai man hơnă hnam akŭm Kră Yang, na đei lu 'bok soi dơ̆ng tơ noh hrŭk ao giĕng păng chĕp keng, na lu bơngai Lêwi, kon sâu Asap, đĭ-đăng chĕp chhar, wă ư-ang kơ Kră Yang kiơ̆ thoi khôi juăt Đawit, pơtao Isơrael, đei pơjing.

English: And they sang responsively, praising and giving thanks to the LORD: “For He is good, For His mercy endures forever toward Israel.” Then all the people shouted with a great shout, when they praised the LORD, because the foundation of the house of the LORD was laid.
Bahnar: Lu sư hơri bơyong dih băl na bơnê ư-ang kơ Kră Yang khan: Trŏ kơ bơnê ư-ang kơ Kră Yang, yua kơ Sư 'lơ̆ng rŏ, sư 'mêm kơ bơngai Isơrael ling-lang khŏm khŏm! Đĭ-đăng kon pơlei ôr jreo re, bơnê ư-ang kơ Kră Yang, yua kơ đe man hơnă hnam akŭm Kră Yang boih.

English: But many of the priests and Levites and heads of the fathers’ houses, old men who had seen the first temple, wept with a loud voice when the foundation of this temple was laid before their eyes. Yet many shouted aloud for joy
Bahnar: Lơ 'bok soi, bơngai Lêwi, kơdră adrĕch adrung, wă khan lu đe kră mă 'bôh hnam akŭm adrol, lu sư nhơ̆m re kơplah đe man hơnă hnam akŭm 'nao 'bơ̆t anăp lu sư. Kŭm đei lơ bơngai nai đei nơ̆r ôr re hiôk chơt 'nă hal

English: so that the people could not discern the noise of the shout of joy from the noise of the weeping of the people, for the people shouted with a loud shout, and the sound was heard afar off.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na đe hơnat kơ băt ayơ tơdrong hiôk chơt păng ayơ tơdrong nhơ̆m hmoi; yua kơ kon pơlei pơla ôr re păng nơ̆r re noh kơtơ̆ng jơ̆k truh tơ ataih.

English: Now when the adversaries of Judah and Benjamin heard that the descendants of the captivity were building the temple of the LORD God of Israel
Bahnar: kơplah lu bơngai ayăt kơ kon pơlei Juđa păng Bênjamin băt kơ lu bơngai mă đêl rôp pơm hơnă wih brŏk gơh pơm hnam akŭm kơkuh kơ Kră Yang Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael

English: they came to Zerubbabel and the heads of the fathers’ houses, and said to them, “Let us build with you, for we seek your God as you do; and we have sacrificed to Him since the days of Esarhaddon king of Assyria, who brought us here.”
Bahnar: lu sư năm tơ Serubabel păng lu kơdră adrĕch adrung na khan thoi âu: Lu nhôn kư̆m 'maih pơjing hnam akŭm hơdai hăm lu iĕm, yua kơ lu nhôn krao chă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm, kư̆m thoi lu iĕm mơ̆n, lu nhôn kư̆m đei soi kơkuh kơ Sư đơ̆ng chăl Êsarhađôn, pơtao Asiri, chĕp ba lu nhôn tơ âu.

English: But Zerubbabel and Jeshua and the rest of the heads of the fathers’ houses of Israel said to them, “You may do nothing with us to build a house for our God; but we alone will build to the LORD God of Israel, as King Cyrus the king of Persia has commanded us.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Serubabel, Jêsua păng lu yŏng kơdră adrĕch adrung đe Isơrael, tơl khan: Iĕm ưh kơ gơh wang pơm hnam akŭm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei hăm lu nhôn ôh; mă-lei lăp hơdrô̆ lu nhôn đĕch, pơjing hnam akŭm Kră Yang Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơngai Isơrael, nhen thoi Sirus, pơtao Phersi đei khan lê̆ boih kơ nhôn.

English: Then the people of the land tried to discourage the people of Judah. They troubled them in building
Bahnar: Kơplah noh kon pơlei kơtă tơhli kon pơlei Juđa tơrơ wă kơdŭn, kơplah lu sư pơjing hnam akŭm

English: and hired counselors against them to frustrate their purpose all the days of Cyrus king of Persia, even until the reign of Darius king of Persia.
Bahnar: păng đĭ chăl Sirus, pơtao Phersia, truh tơ chăl Đarius, pơgơ̆r pơm pơtao Phersia, pơgơ̆r, lu sư apah jên kơ lu bơngai hơlĕnh pơdăr wă blah lu bơngai Juđa, wă pơrăm lê̆ tơdrong jang lu sư pơjing.

English: In the reign of Ahasuerus, in the beginning of his reign, they wrote an accusation against the inhabitants of Judah and Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Trŏ chăl Asêrus, 'nao pơm pơtao, na lu sư chih roi sơlam kơ pơtao dôm tơdrong bơngai Juđa păng lu bơngai oei tơ pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: In the days of Artaxerxes also, Bishlam, Mithredath, Tabel, and the rest of their companions wrote to Artaxerxes king of Persia; and the letter was written in Aramaic script, and translated into the Aramaic language.
Bahnar: Hlôi kơ chăl Artaserses, na Bislam, Mitrêdat, Tabêl păng hơdai đĭ 'bok kuan lu sư, chih roi ăn kơ Artaserses, pơtao Phersia. Hla bơar đe chih ei chih hăm nơ̆r Aram păng ăn kơ pơtao.

English: Rehum the commander and Shimshai the scribe wrote a letter against Jerusalem to King Artaxerxes in this fashion
Bahnar: Kŭm đei dơ̆ng Rêhum, yŏng linh păng Simsai, bơngai chih hla bơar kư̆m chih hla bơar ăn kơ pơtao Artaserses kêng blơ̆ lu bơngai oei tơ pơlei Jêrusalem thoi âu

English: From Rehum the commander, Shimshai the scribe, and the rest of their companions—representatives of the Dinaites, the Apharsathchites, the Tarpelites, the people of Persia and Erech and Babylon and Shushan, the Dehavites, the Elamites
Bahnar: Rêhum, yŏng linh, Simsai, bơngai chih hla bơar păng đĭ-đăng lu sư bơngai bơ̆jang pơm kuan tih, lu kră sek tơlang lu sư bơngai Đinit, bơngai Aphatsathit, bơngai Tatbêlit, bơngai Aphatsit, bơngai Atkêwit, bơngai Babilôn, bơngai Suwan, bơngai Đêhawit, bơngai Êlam

English: and the rest of the nations whom the great and noble Osnapper took captive and settled in the cities of Samaria and the remainder beyond the River —and so forth.
Bahnar: păng lu kon pơlei nai mă Ônapba bơngai yŏng mơng đe pơyom chông ba, wă ăn arih jang sa lăm pơlei Samari păng lăm tơring nai mă oei gah bơmơ̆t kơ đak krong.a

English: (This is a copy of the letter that they sent him) To King Artaxerxes from your servants, the men of the region beyond the River, and so forth
Bahnar: 'Nâu hla bơar chih rok dơ̆ng đơ̆ng kơthơ lu sư đei gơih ăn kơ pơtao Artaserses. Kơkuh kơ pơtao Artaserses arih sot. Lu nhôn đĭch đam ih oei gah bơmơ̆t kơ đak krong.

English: Let it be known to the king that the Jews who came up from you have come to us at Jerusalem, and are building the rebellious and evil city, and are finishing its walls and repairing the foundations.
Bahnar: Kơkuh kơ ih pơtao wă roi kơ ih băt hơđăl lu bơngai Juđa đei brŏk đơ̆ng ih brŏk truh tơ nhôn tơ pơlei Jêrusalem, lu sư pơm pơjing ming pơlei noh pơlei mă juăt pơm kơnê̆ dêh lu sư man ming dur pơlei păng hơmet ming hơnă hnam akŭm boih.

English: Let it now be known to the king that, if this city is built and the walls completed, they will not pay tax, tribute, or custom, and the king’s treasury will be diminished.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, hơpơi kơ ih băt mă nhen, tơdah pơlei âu đei pơm ming dơ̆ng păng dur sư đei man hơtŏk ming, thoi noh đĭ kon pơlei noh ưh pă pơyơ̆r ăn kơ ih dôm tơmam, ưh pă ăn thuê̆ dah ăn jên, na đơ̆ng noh tơdrong răm gô truh kơ ih.

English: Now because we receive support from the palace, it was not proper for us to see the king’s dishonor; therefore we have sent and informed the king
Bahnar: Yua kơ lu nhôn đei sa yua đơ̆ng hnam pơtao ih păng lu nhôn 'maih wă lăng hă tơdrong răm gô truh kơ ih thoi noh, lei na lu nhôn wơh bơngai năm roi ăn kơ ih băt

English: that search may be made in the book of the records of your fathers. And you will find in the book of the records and know that this city is a rebellious city, harmful to kings and provinces, and that they have incited sedition within the city in former times, for which cause this city was destroyed.
Bahnar: ih lăng lăm hla bơar chih răk lu 'bok kră ih: Wă kơ băt lăm hla bơar hơ'mon noh roi băt kơ pơlei 'nâu, 'nâu pơlei mă juăt kơ blơ̆ blĕch pơm pơrăm pơtao, păng dêh char; đơ̆ng sơ̆ boih, đe juăt kơ tơblah băl tơ noh; yua kơ tơdrong ei boih na pơlei âu pơchah jing juơ ưh pă đei dơ̆ng.

English: We inform the king that if this city is rebuilt and its walls are completed, the result will be that you will have no dominion beyond the River.
Bahnar: Lu nhôn roi tơbăt kơ ih băt tơdah pơlei âu đei pơm ming dơ̆ng păng dur pơlei đe man ming dơ̆ng, tơdrong ei ưh kơ jor, ih gô hiong teh đak gah âu kơ đak krong.

English: The king sent an answer: To Rehum the commander, to Shimshai the scribe, to the rest of their companions who dwell in Samaria, and to the remainder beyond the River: Peace, and so forth.
Bahnar: Pơtao hloi chih hla bơar tơjur nơ̆r tơtă ăn kơ yŏng linh Rêhum, ăn kơ Simsai bơngai chih hla bơar păng ăn kơ đĭ-đăng lu bơngai bơ̆jang oei lăm Samari păng oei lăm dêh nai gah bơmơ̆t kơ đak krong, thoi âu: Hơpơi ăn kơ lu iĕm đei tơdrong hiôk-hian.

English: The letter which you sent to us has been clearly read before me.
Bahnar: Kơthơ lu iĕm chih roi noh đei truh tơ inh đei đŏk tơblang rơđah nhen 'bơ̆t anăp inh boih.

English: And I gave the command, and a search has been made, and it was found that this city in former times has revolted against kings, and rebellion and sedition have been fostered in it.
Bahnar: Kiơ̆ dôm nơ̆r inh đei tơtă kơ lu iĕm, đe kư̆m đei lăng hơlen boih, đei 'bôh sơ̆ pơlei âu đei iung blah hăm lu pơtao păng lăm noh đei lơ tơdrong tơblơ̆ tơblĕnh păng tơdrong khŭl hơlĕnh.

English: There have also been mighty kings over Jerusalem, who have ruled over all the region beyond the River; and tax, tribute, and custom were paid to them.
Bahnar: Tơ pơlei Jêrusalem kư̆m đei boih lu pơtao pran kơtang, wei-lăng pơgơ̆r đĭ jơ̆p kơ dêh char gah to đak krong păng lu đe tuh pơyơ̆r ăn tơmam, ăn jên thuê̆ păng ăn jên trong kơ lu pơtao noh.

English: Now give the command to make these men cease, that this city may not be built until the command is given by me.
Bahnar: Kơlih kơ thoi noh, lu iĕm athei roi tơbăt nơ̆r tơtă găn lu bơngai mă wă pơdơ̆ng pơjing pơlei âu, dĭng truh tơ layơ mă inh ăn pơm tơdrong noh na gơh pơm.

English: Take heed now that you do not fail to do this. Why should damage increase to the hurt of the kings?
Bahnar: Kơchăng bĕ tơdrong âu, hli kơ đei tơdrong gleh hloh dơ̆ng kơ lu pơtao.

English: Now when the copy of King Artaxerxes’ letter was read before Rehum, Shimshai the scribe, and their companions, they went up in haste to Jerusalem against the Jews, and by force of arms made them cease.
Bahnar: Lăp wă lu sư đŏk hla bơar pơtao Artaserses chih noh 'bơ̆t anăp Rêhum, Simsai bơngai chih hla bơar păng đĭ-đăng lu bơngai bơ̆jang, na lu sư năm hăt hot hloi truh tơ kon pơlei Juđa tơ pơlei Jêrusalem, iŏk tơdrong gơh păng tơdrong pran kơtang pơm kơ kon pơlei Juđa khă ưh kơ ăn pơm.

English: Thus the work of the house of God which is at Jerusalem ceased, and it was discontinued until the second year of the reign of Darius king of Persia.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, tơdrong jang pơjing hnam akŭm kơkuh kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ pơlei Jêrusalem pơdơh dĭng truh tơ sơnăm mă 'bar chăl Đarius pơm pơtao pơgơ̆r dêh char Phersia.

English: Then the prophet Haggai and Zechariah the son of Iddo, prophets, prophesied to the Jews who were in Judah and Jerusalem, in the name of the God of Israel, who was over them.
Bahnar: Kơplah Hagai păng Sachari kon Iđô pơm 'bok khan lê̆ adrol, yua hăm anăn Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael bơtho khan lê̆ adrol kơ lu bơngai Juđa tơ dêh Juđa păng tơ pơlei Jêrusalem. Wă kơ lu sư iung pơm pơjing hnam akŭm.

English: So Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel and Jeshua the son of Jozadak rose up and began to build the house of God which is in Jerusalem; and the prophets of God were with them, helping them.
Bahnar: Đei Serubabel, kon drŏ-nglo Sêathiel păng Jêsua kon tơdăm Jôsađăk, bre sư iung, tơgŭm pơtơm pơjing hnam akŭm kơkuh kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ pơlei Jêrusalem păng đei lu 'bok khan lê̆ adrol Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei wang tơgŭm.

English: At the same time Tattenai the governor of the region beyond the River and Shethar-Boznai and their companions came to them and spoke thus to them: “Who has commanded you to build this temple and finish this wall?”
Bahnar: Lăm kơplah noh, Tatênai pơm 'bok tih pơgơ̆r dêh gah bơmơ̆t đak krong păng Sathar Bôsênai păng đĭ khŭl lu sư bơngai bơ̆jang, năm tơ Jêrusalem chơchă kon pơlei Juđa păng khan kơ lu sư thoi âu: Bu athei iĕm pơm pơjing hnam akŭm âu păng man ming dur pơlei âu?

English: Then, accordingly, we told them the names of the men who were constructing this building.
Bahnar: Kŭm apinh hloi anăn lu bơngai mă pơjing pơm hnam akŭm âu.

English: But the eye of their God was upon the elders of the Jews, so that they could not make them cease till a report could go to Darius. Then a written answer was returned concerning this matter.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei wei-lăng lu kră pơgơ̆r kon pơlei Juđa, thoi noh lu đe noh ưh kơ đei gơh pơgăn, gô chih roi tơdrong noh kơ pơtao Đarius băt, gô mơ̆ng kơ pơtao chih tơjur ăn thoi yơ.

English: This is a copy of the letter that Tattenai sent: The governor of the region beyond the River, and Shethar-Boznai, and his companions, the Persians who were in the region beyond the River, to Darius the king.
Bahnar: 'Nâu hla bơar đei chih rok dơ̆ng đơ̆ng hla bơar 'bok Tatênai, yŏng pơgơ̆r dêh gah bơmơ̆t đak krong, Sêthar Bôsênai păng đĭ khŭl lu sư bơ̆jang, wă khan lu bơngai Aphatsak oei gah âu đak krong, đei roi kơ pơtao Đarius

English: (They sent a letter to him, in which was written thus) To Darius the king: All peace.
Bahnar: thoi nơ̆r 'nâu: “Hơpơi kơ pơtao Đarius hiôk-hian tôm tơdrong!

English: Let it be known to the king that we went into the province of Judea, to the temple of the great God, which is being built with heavy stones, and timber is being laid in the walls; and this work goes on diligently and prospers in their hands.
Bahnar: Nhôn wă kơ ih băt kơ lu nhôn năm boih lăm dêh Juđa, năm truh tơ hnam akŭm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tih 'bôh bơngai Juđa man hnam akŭm noh hăm tơmo tih; bơbŭng hnam đe jrŏng roh 'long hơgơn tơ tơnăr hnam boih păng tơdrong jang hơlen dêh păng tơdrong jang kư̆m rai 'net 'net tơ anăp lăm tơpang ti lu sư jang.

English: Then we asked those elders, and spoke thus to them: “Who commanded you to build this temple and to finish these walls?”
Bahnar: Lu nhôn đei apinh lu đe kră pơgơ̆r pơlei thoi âu: Bu ăn kơ iĕm pơm hnam akŭm âu păng man dur pơlei âu?

English: We also asked them their names to inform you, that we might write the names of the men who were chief among them.
Bahnar: Lu nhôn kư̆m apinh anăn lu sư, wă kơ gơh roi ăn kơ ih băt kơ anăn lu bơngai wei-lăng pơgơ̆r lu sư.

English: And thus they returned us an answer, saying: “We are the servants of the God of heaven and earth, and we are rebuilding the temple that was built many years ago, which a great king of Israel built and completed.
Bahnar: Lu sư tơl nơ̆r thoi âu: Lu nhôn boih đĭch đam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, Kră Yang pơgơ̆r đĭ-đăng plĕnh păng teh; lu nhôn oei wă pơm pơjing dơ̆ng hnam akŭm, đunh sơnăm boih adrol kơ âu đei minh 'nu pơtao mơdrŏng đe pơyua lăm Isơrael đei pơjing păng pơm.

English: But because our fathers provoked the God of heaven to wrath, He gave them into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, the Chaldean, who destroyed this temple and carried the people away to Babylon.
Bahnar: Mă-lei 'bok yă lu nhôn ưh kơ chu Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei plĕnh teh, na Sư jao lu nhôn tơ lăm ti Nebukatnessar, pơtao Babilôn, bơngai Kalđê; pơtao ei sơ̆ pơrăm hnam akŭm âu păng rôp kon pơlei chông ba tơ dêh Babilôn.

English: However, in the first year of Cyrus king of Babylon, King Cyrus issued a decree to build this house of God.
Bahnar: Mă-lei sơnăm blŭng-a lăm chăl Sirus, pơtao Babilôn, pơtao Sirus athei pơjing pơm ming hnam akŭm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Also, the gold and silver articles of the house of God, which Nebuchadnezzar had taken from the temple that was in Jerusalem and carried into the temple of Babylon—those King Cyrus took from the temple of Babylon, and they were given to one named Sheshbazzar, whom he had made governor.
Bahnar: Pơtao Sirus kư̆m đei iŏk pơdrâu dôm lu tơmam kơthao hu, maih đơ̆ng lăm hnam yang Babilôn mă pơtao Nebukatnessar đei iŏk đơ̆ng lăm hnam akŭm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ pơlei Jêrusalem, na chĕp ba tơmam noh tơ hnam yang Babilôn; Sirus pơjao ăn kơ Sêsbasar, mă sư đei ăn pơm 'bok yŏng pơgơ̆r

English: And he said to him, ‘Take these articles; go, carry them to the temple site that is in Jerusalem, and let the house of God be rebuilt on its former site.’
Bahnar: păng khan kơ sư thoi âu: Iŏk bĕ dôm pơnhan tơmam gĭt 'nâu, năm 'măn tơ hnam akŭm tơ pơlei Jêrusalem păng pơjing pơm ming dơ̆ng hnam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'bơ̆t anih so sư.

English: Then the same Sheshbazzar came and laid the foundation of the house of God which is in Jerusalem; but from that time even until now it has been under construction, and it is not finished.”
Bahnar: Kơplah noh, Sêsbasar truh đei pơjing ming hnam akŭm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ pơlei Jêrusalem; păng đơ̆ng noh truh tơ dang ei, đe oei pơm, mă-lei tam mă keh.

English: Now therefore, if it seems good to the king, let a search be made in the king’s treasure house, which is there in Babylon, whether it is so that a decree was issued by King Cyrus to build this house of God at Jerusalem, and let the king send us his pleasure concerning this matter.
Bahnar: Thoi noh dang ei, dah ih lăp đon, chă lăng pơnhen bĕ lăm anih tah răk hla bơar tơ dêh Babilôn, lăng lăng hăm trŏ kơ pơtao Sirus đei tơjur ăn gơh pơm ming dơ̆ng hnam akŭm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ pơlei Jêrusalem dah ưh. Đơ̆ng noh, apinh ih ăn kơ nhôn băt, bơtho lu nhôn wă kơ lu nhôn pơm kiơ̆ thoi ih wă.”

English: Then King Darius issued a decree, and a search was made in the archives, where the treasures were stored in Babylon.
Bahnar: Pơtao Đarius sư athei đe chă lăng hơlen tơ lăm anih tah hla bơar, anih mong tơmam tơ Babilôn.

English: And at Achmetha, in the palace that is in the province of Media, a scroll was found, and in it a record was written thus
Bahnar: Đe chă 'bôh tơ lăm hnam pơtao tơ pơlei Ekbatana tơ lăm tơring Mêđi, đei minh sơ̆p hla bơar so sơ̆ đei 'măn lê̆ đei chih thoi âu

English: In the first year of King Cyrus, King Cyrus issued a decree concerning the house of God at Jerusalem: “Let the house be rebuilt, the place where they offered sacrifices; and let the foundations of it be firmly laid, its height sixty cubits and its width sixty cubits
Bahnar: Sơnăm blŭng-a chăl Sirus pơm pơtao, pơtao Sirus đei chih tơjur ăn hla bơar gah tơdrong pơm hnam akŭm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem thoi âu: Pơm ming bĕ hnam akŭm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, wă pơm anih pơyơ̆r dôm lu tơmam soi; lu hơnă sư athei pơm mă kơjăp, kơjung sư pêng-jĭt hlok tor sư pêng-jĭt hlok

English: with three rows of heavy stones and one row of new timber. Let the expenses be paid from the king’s treasury.
Bahnar: pơm pêng trong tơmo tih păng minh trong hơpok 'long 'nao; mă jên pơhuach pơm noh iŏk đơ̆ng lăm hnam mong tơmam pơtao ăn.

English: Also let the gold and silver articles of the house of God, which Nebuchadnezzar took from the temple which is in Jerusalem and brought to Babylon, be restored and taken back to the temple which is in Jerusalem, each to its place; and deposit them in the house of God”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh dơ̆ng, lu tơmam gĭt pơm hăm maih păng hăm hu lăm hnam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, mă Nebukatnessar đei iŏk đơ̆ng lăm hnam akŭm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem chĕp ba tơ Babilôn, athei pơdrâu păng chĕp ba tơ hnam akŭm Pơlei Jêrusalem; ih athei dan đêl tơ anih so sư lăm hnam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Now therefore, Tattenai, governor of the region beyond the River, and Shethar-Boznai, and your companions the Persians who are beyond the River, keep yourselves far from there.
Bahnar: Thoi noh dang ei, ơ Tatênai pơm 'bok pơgơ̆r gah bơmơ̆t đak krong, Sêthar Bôsênai păng đĭ-đăng lu bơngai bơ̆jang tơ Aphatsak gah to đak krong, athei weh bĕ đơ̆ng noh

English: Let the work of this house of God alone; let the governor of the Jews and the elders of the Jews build this house of God on its site.
Bahnar: athei lê̆ 'bok kuan wei-lăng lu bơngai Juđa păng lu bơngai kơdră pơgơ̆r lu sư pơjing hnam akŭm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ anih so sư.

English: Moreover I issue a decree as to what you shall do for the elders of these Jews, for the building of this house of God: Let the cost be paid at the king’s expense from taxes on the region beyond the River; this is to be given immediately to these men, so that they are not hindered.
Bahnar: 'Nâu nơ̆r inh athei, iĕm athei pơm kiơ̆ hăm lu đe kơdră pơgơ̆r kon pơlei Juđa, wă tơgŭm pơm dơ̆ng hnam akŭm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei: Athei iŏk dôm lu tơmam đei ra đơ̆ng gah to đak krong, jah ăn jên 'nĕ kơ hiơ̆ ăn kơ lu bơngai noh, wă kơ tơdrong jang ưh kơ đei layơ kơtĕch pơdơh.

English: And whatever they need—young bulls, rams, and lambs for the burnt offerings of the God of heaven, wheat, salt, wine, and oil, according to the request of the priests who are in Jerusalem—let it be given them day by day without fail
Bahnar: Rim năr athei ăn kơ lu 'bok soi tơ Jêrusalem lu tơmam soi mă kăl hloh wă kơ sư pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei rơmo tơno, triu tơno, triu tơno kon, 'ba mi, 'boh, sik, dah đak rơmă, 'nĕ kơ kơ'bah ôh

English: that they may offer sacrifices of sweet aroma to the God of heaven, and pray for the life of the king and his sons.
Bahnar: wă kơ lu sư soi pơyơ̆r lu tơmam soi 'bâu phu ăn kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei kơpal plĕnh lăp đon păng krao khan kơ tơdrong arih pơtao păng lu kon drŏ-nglo inh.

English: Also I issue a decree that whoever alters this edict, let a timber be pulled from his house and erected, and let him be hanged on it; and let his house be made a refuse heap because of this.
Bahnar: Inh đei nơ̆r tơtă thoi âu: Tơdah đe bu pơjah hăm nơ̆r inh đei chih tơjur âu, na athei hor iŏk minh pôm 'long hơpok đơ̆ng hnam bơngai noh păng chô̆ hơtol sư tơ noh, yua kơ tơdrong yoch noh, pơm kơ hnam sư jing anih đe tuh 'bruih 'brăm.

English: And may the God who causes His name to dwell there destroy any king or people who put their hand to alter it, or to destroy this house of God which is in Jerusalem. I Darius issue a decree; let it be done diligently.
Bahnar: Apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, Tơ'ngla mă pơm ăn kơ anăn Sư oei lăm hnam akŭm noh, pơrăm lê̆ pơtao ayơ, kon pơlei ayơ mă pơ̆n yơ̆r ti pơjah hăm nơ̆r đei tơjur âu wă pơrăm hnam akŭm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ pơlei Jêrusalem. Inh Đarius đei chih tơjur nơ̆r tơtă âu. Athei pơm kiơ̆ nơ̆r âu mă pơ'lơ̆ng!

English: Then Tattenai, governor of the region beyond the River, Shethar-Boznai, and their companions diligently did according to what King Darius had sent.
Bahnar: Tatênai, 'bok kuan tih pơgơ̆r dêh gah to đak krong, Sêthar Bôsênai păng lu bơngai bơ̆jang hơdai lu sư, lu sư pơm kiơ̆ 'blep trŏ thoi nơ̆r pơtao Đarius đei tơtă.

English: So the elders of the Jews built, and they prospered through the prophesying of Haggai the prophet and Zechariah the son of Iddo. And they built and finished it, according to the commandment of the God of Israel, and according to the command of Cyrus, Darius, and Artaxerxes king of Persia.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, lu đe kră pơgơ̆r kon pơlei Juđa pơtơm pơjing ming dơ̆ng hnam akŭm, tơdrong jang pŭn hiôk tơpă, 'blep trŏ thoi nơ̆r Hagai păng Sachari khan lê̆ adrol, kon drŏ-nglo Iđô. Thoi noh lu sư pơm keh hnam akŭm kiơ̆ kơ nơ̆r tơtă đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu đe Isơrael păng kư̆m kiơ̆ kơ nơ̆r tơjur đơ̆ng Sirus, Đarius păng Artaserses pơtao dêh char Phersia.

English: Now the temple was finished on the third day of the month of Adar, which was in the sixth year of the reign of King Darius.
Bahnar: Năr mă pêng khei Adar, trŏ kơ sơnăm mă tơdrâu chăl pơtao Đarius, hnam akŭm âu pơm keh.

English: Then the children of Israel, the priests and the Levites and the rest of the descendants of the captivity, celebrated the dedication of this house of God with joy.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Isơrael, lu 'bok soi bơngai Lêwi noh lu bơngai mă đe rôp pơm bơnă wih brŏk, đĭ-đăng lu sư chơt hiôk pơm giĕng et sa pơih hnam akŭm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei keh.

English: And they offered sacrifices at the dedication of this house of God, one hundred bulls, two hundred rams, four hundred lambs, and as a sin offering for all Israel twelve male goats, according to the number of the tribes of Israel.
Bahnar: Gah tơdrong pơm giĕng et sa pơih hnam akŭm keh âu, lu sư pơyơ̆r minh-hrĕng tŏ rơmo dăm, 'bar-hrĕng tŏ triu dăm, puăn-hrĕng tŏ triu tơno păng kiơ̆ kơ lu adrĕch bơngai Isơrael, lu sư pơyơ̆r mơjĭt-'bar tŏ bơbe dăm pơm tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch ăn kơ mơjĭt-'bar adrĕch bơngai Isơrael.

English: They assigned the priests to their divisions and the Levites to their divisions, over the service of God in Jerusalem, as it is written in the Book of Moses.
Bahnar: Lu 'bok soi păng lu bơngai Lêwi kiơ̆ kơ khŭl lu sư klah asong wă bơ̆jang kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem, kiơ̆ thoi lăm sơ̆p hla bơar Môis đei chih.

English: And the descendants of the captivity kept the Passover on the fourteenth day of the first month.
Bahnar: Trŏ năr mơjĭt-puăn khei mônh, lu bơngai đêl đe đei rôp pơm bơnă wih brŏk, 'blŏk pơm giĕng năm brih.

English: For the priests and the Levites had purified themselves; all of them were ritually clean. And they slaughtered the Passover lambs for all the descendants of the captivity, for their brethren the priests, and for themselves.
Bahnar: Lu 'bok soi păng bơngai Lêwi, đĭ-đăng lu sư hơmet akâu kơdih wă kơ rơgoh, na pơlôch triu năm brih ăn kơ đĭ-đăng lu bơngai đêl pơm bơnă wih brŏk ăn kơ lu 'nhŏng oh 'bok soi lu sư kơdih păng yua kơ kơdih akâu, pơm sŏng sa giĕng năm brih âu hơdai hăm lu bơngai Isơrael.

English: Then the children of Israel who had returned from the captivity ate together with all who had separated themselves from the filth of the nations of the land in order to seek the LORD God of Israel.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Isơrael hŭt lê̆ tơdrong kơkuh kơ yang kư̆ kă, lu sư kiơ̆ bơngai Isơrael, wă krao chă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đe Isơrael.

English: And they kept the Feast of Unleavened Bread seven days with joy; for the LORD made them joyful, and turned the heart of the king of Assyria toward them, to strengthen their hands in the work of the house of God, the God of Israel.
Bahnar: Lăm tơpơh năr lu sư 'blŏk pơm giĕng 'bĕng ưh kơ đei 'buih pông lu sư đei jơhngơ̆m hiôk chơt; yua kơ Kră Yang pơm ăn păng pơm ăn kơ jơhngơ̆m pơtao Asiri đei mơnat, tơgŭm lăm tơdrong pơjing pơm hnam akŭm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đe Isơrael.

English: Now after these things, in the reign of Artaxerxes king of Persia, Ezra the son of Seraiah, the son of Azariah, the son of Hilkiah
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng lu tơdrong ei, trŏ kơ lăm chăl Artaserses, pơtao Phersia, đei Esơra, kon drŏ-nglo Sêraia

English: the son of Shallum, the son of Zadok, the son of Ahitub
Bahnar: Sêraia kon drŏ-nglo Hilkia, Hilkia kon Sallum, Sallum kon drŏ-nglo Sađŏk, Sađŏk kon drŏ-nglo Ahitup.

English: the son of Amariah, the son of Azariah, the son of Meraioth
Bahnar: Ahitup kon drŏ-nglo Amaria, Amaria kon drŏ-nglo Asaria, Asaria kon drŏ-nglo Mêrayôt.

English: the son of Zerahiah, the son of Uzzi, the son of Bukki
Bahnar: Mêrayôt kon drŏ-nglo Sêrahia, Sêrahia kon drŏ-nglo Usi

English: the son of Abishua, the son of Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the chief priest
Bahnar: Usi kon drŏ-nglo Buki, Buki kon Abisua, Abisua kon Phinêhas, Phinêhas kon drŏ-nglo Êlêasar, Êlêasar kon drŏ-nglo Arôn boih 'bok soi tơm.

English: this Ezra came up from Babylon; and he was a skilled scribe in the Law of Moses, which the LORD God of Israel had given. The king granted him all his request, according to the hand of the LORD his God upon him.
Bahnar: Esơra âu sư wih brŏk đơ̆ng Babilôn. Sư jơ̆ minh 'nu bơngai bơtho hơgei hlôh kloh klĕch khôi juăt Môis, mă Kră Yang Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đe Isơrael đei chih roi. Yua kơ ti Kră Yang tơgŭm sư, thoi noh pơtao asong ăn dôm tơdrong sư apinh.

English: Some of the children of Israel, the priests, the Levites, the singers, the gatekeepers, and the Nethinim came up to Jerusalem in the seventh year of King Artaxerxes.
Bahnar: 'Blep lăm sơnăm mă tơpơh, chăl pơtao Artaserses, đei lu kon pơlei Isơrael, lu 'bok soi păng bơngai Lêwi, lu bơngai hơri, lu bơngai gak 'măng păng lu bơngai Nêthinim, đĭ-đăng wih brŏk hơdai sư tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: And Ezra came to Jerusalem in the fifth month, which was in the seventh year of the king.
Bahnar: Khei pơđăm sơnăm mă tơpơh chăl pơtao Artaserses, Esơra truh tơ pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: On the first day of the first month he began his journey from Babylon, and on the first day of the fifth month he came to Jerusalem, according to the good hand of his God upon him.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, năr mônh khei mônh, sư đơ̆ng dêh Babilôn pơtơm wih brŏk blŭng-a, yua kơ đơ̆ng ti Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'mêm wei-lăng tơgŭm, sư truh tơ pơlei Jêrusalem năr mônh khei mă pơđăm.

English: For Ezra had prepared his heart to seek the Law of the LORD, and to do it, and to teach statutes and ordinances in Israel.
Bahnar: Esơra đei ling-lang lăng hŏk iŏk khôi juăt Kră Yang, wei răk pơm kiơ̆ păng bơtho ăn kơ kon pơlei Isơrael băt kơ dôm khôi juăt păng dôm tơdrong đei tơtă.

English: This is a copy of the letter that King Artaxerxes gave Ezra the priest, the scribe, expert in the words of the commandments of the LORD, and of His statutes to Israel
Bahnar: 'Nâu jơ̆ hla bơar chih rok đêl nơ̆r tơtă đơ̆ng pơtao Artaserses pơjao ăn kơ Esơra, 'bok soi păng bơngai bơtho hơgei gah sơ̆p hla bơar, hlôh tôm khôi juăt, nơ̆r tơtă Kră Yang Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ đe Isơrael.

English: Artaxerxes, king of kings, To Ezra the priest, a scribe of the Law of the God of heaven: Perfect peace, and so forth.
Bahnar: Artaserses, pơtao kơ lu pơtao, gơih ăn kơ Esơra, 'bok soi bơngai bơtho hơgei kơ hla bơar, hlôh tôm khôi juăt Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei kơpal plĕnh, hơpơi ăn kơ ih hiôk-hian lăm tôm tơdrong.

English: I issue a decree that all those of the people of Israel and the priests and Levites in my realm, who volunteer to go up to Jerusalem, may go with you.
Bahnar: Inh chih nơ̆r tơtă ăn kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai bu oei lăm teh đak inh, gah kon pơlei Isơrael, 'bok soi tơm păng lu bơngai Lêwi, wă wih brŏk tơ pơlei Jêrusalem, na athei năm hơdai hăm ih.

English: And whereas you are being sent by the king and his seven counselors to inquire concerning Judah and Jerusalem, with regard to the Law of your God which is in your hand
Bahnar: Inh păng tơpơh 'nu bơngai hơgei wơh ih brŏk chă lăng wă kơ băt lăm bơngai Juđa păng tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem, hăm kiơ̆ kơ khôi juăt Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei mă đei chih rok ih oei chĕp lăm ti ih.

English: and whereas you are to carry the silver and gold which the king and his counselors have freely offered to the God of Israel, whose dwelling is in Jerusalem
Bahnar: Ih gô chĕp ba hăm ih lu hu păng maih mă pơtao păng lu bơngai hơgei lăp đon pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đe Isơrael, oei lăm pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: and whereas all the silver and gold that you may find in all the province of Babylon, along with the freewill offering of the people and the priests, are to be freely offered for the house of their God in Jerusalem
Bahnar: Hăm lu hu maih mă lu kon pơlei Isơrael păng lu 'bok soi oei lăm tơring dêh Babilôn, lu sư đei pơyơ̆r kơ hnam akŭm kơkuh kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư tơ pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: now therefore, be careful to buy with this money bulls, rams, and lambs, with their grain offerings and their drink offerings, and offer them on the altar of the house of your God in Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Ih yua jên âu răt lu rơmo dăm, triu dăm, triu tơno kon hăm phe 'ba tơmam soi pơyơ̆r, na pơyơ̆r tơ kơpal kơ chơnang soi lăm hnam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm, tơ pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: And whatever seems good to you and your brethren to do with the rest of the silver and the gold, do it according to the will of your God.
Bahnar: Lu hu păng maih mă oei rơkah, dah wă yua lăm tơdrong kiơ trŏ, kiơ̆ kơ ih păng lu 'nhŏng oh ih khan 'lơ̆ng na pơm kiơ̆ thoi Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm lăp đon.

English: Also the articles that are given to you for the service of the house of your God, deliver in full before the God of Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Gah lu tơmam yua đei jao ăn kơ ih wă yua lăm tơdrong kơkuh lăm hnam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih athei dan 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: And whatever more may be needed for the house of your God, which you may have occasion to provide, pay for it from the king’s treasury.
Bahnar: Gah dôm lu tơmam nai ih kăl wă yua pơhuach lăm hnam akŭm kơkuh kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih, iŏk bĕ lu tơmam noh đơ̆ng lăm hnam mong tơmam pơtao.

English: And I, even I, Artaxerxes the king, issue a decree to all the treasurers who are in the region beyond the River, that whatever Ezra the priest, the scribe of the Law of the God of heaven, may require of you, let it be done diligently
Bahnar: Thoi noh, inh boih pơtao Artaserses đei chih roi ăn kơ lu 'bok kuan wei hnam mong tơmam gah bơmơ̆t kơ đak krong khan mă tơmam kiơ Esơra, 'bok soi bơngai bơtho hơgei kơ hla bơar, hlôh băt dôm khôi juăt Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ kơpal plĕnh, gô apinh đơ̆ng lu iĕm, lu iĕm athei ăn hloi.

English: up to one hundred talents of silver, one hundred kors of wheat, one hundred baths of wine, one hundred baths of oil, and salt without prescribed limit.
Bahnar: Truh đei minh-hrĕng hlak talânga jên hu, minh-hrĕng hnŏngb 'bao 'ba tơ'bâu, minh-hrĕng kơthŭng sik, minh-hrĕng kơthŭngc đak rơmă păng 'boh ưh kơ kĕ jô̆ dôm yơ.

English: Whatever is commanded by the God of heaven, let it diligently be done for the house of the God of heaven. For why should there be wrath against the realm of the king and his sons?
Bahnar: Mă tôm tơdrong kiơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei kơpal plĕnh đei bơtho khan gah hnam Sư, athei pơm mă tôm bĕ, tơdah ưh kơnh hli kơ tơdrong truh pơmat lăm dêh char, tơ pơtao păng truh tơ lu kon pơtao.

English: Also we inform you that it shall not be lawful to impose tax, tribute, or custom on any of the priests, Levites, singers, gatekeepers, Nethinim, or servants of this house of God.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh dơ̆ng, inh đei chih roi kơ iĕm băt ưh kơ gơh iŏk thuê̆ tơmam dah jên đơ̆ng 'bok soi, bơngai Lêwi, lu khŭl hơri, bơngai gak 'măng, bơngai Nêthinim, dah lu đam lăm hnam akŭm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: And you, Ezra, according to your God-given wisdom, set magistrates and judges who may judge all the people who are in the region beyond the River, all such as know the laws of your God; and teach those who do not know them.
Bahnar: Gah ih, ơ Esơra, kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong hơgei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih, đei boih lăm ti ih, pơjing bĕ lu 'bok wei-lăng, 'bok sek tơlang, jĭ lu bơngai hlôh băt tôm khôi juăt Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ ih, wă kơ lu sư sek tơlang ăn đĭ kon pơlei oei gah bơmơ̆t kơ đak krong; na lu đe bu mă ưh kơ băt khôi juăt, ih athei bơtho lu sư wă kơ băt.

English: Whoever will not observe the law of your God and the law of the king, let judgment be executed speedily on him, whether it be death, or banishment, or confiscation of goods, or imprisonment.
Bahnar: Tơdah lu đe bu ưh kơ pơm kiơ̆ khôi juăt Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih păng khôi juăt pơtao, na lu iĕm athei sek tơlang phak lu sư hloi, dah pơlôch, dah puh tơweh, dah iŏk đi mŭk tơmam dah rôp phak, kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong sư glăi.

English: Blessed be the LORD God of our fathers, who has put such a thing as this in the king’s heart, to beautify the house of the LORD which is in Jerusalem
Bahnar: Na Esơra khan thoi âu: Trŏ bơnê ư-ang dêh tơpă kơ Kră Yang Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu 'bok yă bơ̆n, đei hơmet jơhngơ̆m pơtao wă hơmet pơrŏ ming hnam akŭm Kră Yang tơ pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: and has extended mercy to me before the king and his counselors, and before all the king’s mighty princes. So I was encouraged, as the hand of the LORD my God was upon me; and I gathered leading men of Israel to go up with me.
Bahnar: Păng ăn kơ inh đei tơdrong pŭn hiôk 'bơ̆t anăp pơtao păng 'bơ̆t anăp lu bơngai hơgei păng lu kuan tih gơh kĕ đơ̆ng pơtao ăn! Thoi noh, inh hiôk dêh, yua kơ ti Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh tơgŭm inh pơ̆n nuih păng krao akŭm lu kơdră adrĕch adrung đe Isơrael wă yak năm hơdai hăm inh.

English: These are the heads of their fathers’ houses, and this is the genealogy of those who went up with me from Babylon, in the reign of King Artaxerxes
Bahnar: 'Nâu, lu kơdră mă pơgơ̆r adrĕch adrung, khŭl bơngai đơ̆ng Babilôn wih hăm inh, lăm chăl pơtao Artaserses pơgơ̆r.

English: of the sons of Phinehas, Gershom; of the sons of Ithamar, Daniel; of the sons of David, Hattush
Bahnar: Gah kon sâu Phinêhas đei Gersôm; gah kon sâu Ithamar đei Đaniel; gah kon sâu Đawit đei Hatus

English: of the sons of Shecaniah, of the sons of Parosh, Zechariah; and registered with him were one hundred and fifty males
Bahnar: Hatus kon sâu Sêkania, kon sâu Pharôs đei Sachari; păng lu bơngai oei hơdai sư; kiơ̆ kơ jô̆ adrĕch adrung đei minh-hrĕng pơđăm-jĭt 'nu drŏ-nglo

English: of the sons of Pahath-Moab, Eliehoenai the son of Zerahiah, and with him two hundred males
Bahnar: Gah kon sâu Phahat Môap đei Êlihôênai kon drŏ-nglo Sêrahia hăm đĭ lu sư đei 'bar-hrĕng 'nu drŏ-nglo

English: of the sons of Shechaniah, Ben-Jahaziel, and with him three hundred males
Bahnar: Gah kon sâu Satu đei Sêkania kon drŏ-nglo Jahasiêl păng đĭ lu sư đei pêng-hrĕng 'nu drŏ-nglo

English: of the sons of Adin, Ebed the son of Jonathan, and with him fifty males
Bahnar: Gah kon sâu Adin đei Êbêt kon drŏ-nglo Jônathan păng đĭ-đăng đei pơđăm-jĭt 'nu drŏ-nglo

English: of the sons of Elam, Jeshaiah the son of Athaliah, and with him seventy males
Bahnar: gah kon sâu Êlam đei Jêsaia, kon drŏ-nglo Athalia păng đĭ-đăng đei tơpơh-jĭt 'nu drŏ-nglo nơ̆r âu: Esơra sư khan thoi âu: Nơ̆r âu ưh kơ đei lăm sơ̆p hla bơar tơm.

English: of the sons of Shephatiah, Zebadiah the son of Michael, and with him eighty males
Bahnar: Gah kon sâu Sêphatia đei Sêbađia, kon drŏ-nglo Mikel păng đĭ-đăng đei tơhngam-jĭt 'nu drŏ-nglo

English: of the sons of Joab, Obadiah the son of Jehiel, and with him two hundred and eighteen males
Bahnar: gah kon sâu Jôap đei Abdia, kon drŏ-nglo Jêhiêl păng đĭ-đăng đei 'bar-hrĕng jĭt tơhngam 'nu drŏ-nglo

English: of the sons of Shelomith, Ben-Josiphiah, and with him one hundred and sixty males
Bahnar: gah kon sâu Bani đei Sêlômit kon drŏ-nglo Jôsiphia păng đĭ-đăng đei minh-hrĕng tơdrâu-jĭt 'nu drŏ-nglo

English: of the sons of Bebai, Zechariah the son of Bebai, and with him twenty-eight males
Bahnar: gah kon sâu Bêbai, đei Sachari, kon drŏ-nglo Bêbai păng đĭ-đăng đei 'bar-jĭt tơhngam 'nu drŏ-nglo

English: of the sons of Azgad, Johanan the son of Hakkatan, and with him one hundred and ten males
Bahnar: Gah kon sâu Agat đei Jôhanan, kon drŏ-nglo Hakatan păng đĭ-đăng đei minh-hrĕng mơjĭt 'nu drŏ-nglo

English: of the last sons of Adonikam, whose names are these—Eliphelet, Jeiel, and Shemaiah—and with them sixty males
Bahnar: Lu bơngai oei gah kon sâu Ađônikam truh hơtuch hloh kơ đĭ-đăng; anăn lu sư: Êliphêlet, Jêuel păng Sêmaia păng lu sư đĭ-đăng đei tơdrâu-jĭt 'nu drŏ-nglo

English: also of the sons of Bigvai, Uthai and Zabbud, and with them seventy males.
Bahnar: gah kon sâu Bikwai đei Uthai hăm Sakur păng đi lu sư đei tơpơh-jĭt 'nu drŏ-nglo.

English: Now I gathered them by the river that flows to Ahava, and we camped there three days. And I looked among the people and the priests, and found none of the sons of Levi there.
Bahnar: Inh krao akŭm lu sư jê̆ đak krong ro tơ Ahawa đơ̆ng noh lu nhôn pơm anih tơ noh pêng năr, đơ̆ng noh inh chă lăng lu kon pơlei păng 'bok soi, mă-lei ưh kơ 'bôh bơngai Lêwi ôh.

English: Then I sent for Eliezer, Ariel, Shemaiah, Elnathan, Jarib, Elnathan, Nathan, Zechariah, and Meshullam, leaders; also for Joiarib and Elnathan, men of understanding.
Bahnar: Inh hloi wơh đe năm krao Adrĕch adrung Êliêser, Ariêl, Sêmaia, Êlnathan, Jarip Êlnathan, Nathan, Sachari păng Mêsulam, jing yŏng păng kư̆m krao Jôiarip păng Êlnathan hloi, bơngai đei 'bơ̆r đon.

English: And I gave them a command for Iddo the chief man at the place Casiphia, and I told them what they should say to Iddo and his brethren the Nethinim at the place Casiphia—that they should bring us servants for the house of our God.
Bahnar: Inh wơh lu sư năm khan kơ kơdră Iđô tơ pơlei Kasiphia, inh bơtho kơ sư wă pơma khan kơ Iđô thoi yơ păng lu 'nhŏng oh sư, lu bơngai bơ̆jang tơ lăm hnam akŭm Kasiphia, wă apinh gơih ăn kơ lu nhôn lu bơngai gơh jang tơgŭm lăm hnam akŭm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n.

English: Then, by the good hand of our God upon us, they brought us a man of understanding, of the sons of Mahli the son of Levi, the son of Israel, namely Sherebiah, with his sons and brothers, eighteen men
Bahnar: Yua kơ đơ̆ng ti Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n tơgŭm, lu sư ba ăn tơ lu bơ̆n minh 'nu bơngai hơgei, sư adrĕch adrung Mahli, noh kon drŏ-nglo Lêwi kon drŏ-nglo Isơrael, hăm Sêrêbia păng lu kon drŏ-nglo sư hăm lu 'nhŏng oh sư, đei mơjĭt-tơhngam 'nu

English: and Hashabiah, and with him Jeshaiah of the sons of Merari, his brothers and their sons, twenty men
Bahnar: kư̆m đei Hasabia păng Jêsaia, lăm adrĕch Mêrari, hăm lu 'nhŏng oh sư păng lu kon drŏ-nglo sư, đei 'bar-jĭt 'nu

English: also of the Nethinim, whom David and the leaders had appointed for the service of the Levites, two hundred and twenty Nethinim. All of them were designated by name.
Bahnar: lăm lu bơngai Nêthinim na mă Đawit păng lu kơdră wei-lăng đei song ăn tơgŭm tơdrong jang bơngai Lêwi, đei 'bar-hrĕng 'bar-jĭt 'nu đĕch, đĭ lu sư đei chih tơmơ̆t anăn ngăl.

English: Then I proclaimed a fast there at the river of Ahava, that we might humble ourselves before our God, to seek from Him the right way for us and our little ones and all our possessions.
Bahnar: Tơ jê̆ đak krong Ahawa, inh athei đĭ-đăng ơ̆t kơ sŏng sa, wă kơ bơ̆n drap kơkuh 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n, krao apinh sư tơ'bôh ăn kơ bơ̆n kon sâu lu bơ̆n păng tơmam bơ̆n đei hiôk-hian kơplah bơ̆n yak rok trong.

English: For I was ashamed to request of the king an escort of soldiers and horsemen to help us against the enemy on the road, because we had spoken to the king, saying, “The hand of our God is upon all those for good who seek Him, but His power and His wrath are against all those who forsake Him.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei inh, mơlâu, ưh kơ pơ̆n apinh pơtao ăn minh grŭp linh păng linh hao seh, dŏng tơgŭm lu bơ̆n đơ̆ng ayăt kơplah lu bơ̆n năm rok trong; yua kơ lu bơ̆n đei khan kơ pơtao thoi âu: Ti Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu nhôn wei-lăng tơgŭm lu bơngai băt krao chă Sư; mă-lei tơdrong mơsêh păng tơdrong hil mĭl Sư blah lu bơngai bu mă blah Sư.

English: So we fasted and entreated our God for this, and He answered our prayer.
Bahnar: Thoi ei, lu bơ̆n athei ơ̆t kơ sŏng sa wă krao khan apinh Sư ăn kơ bơ̆n yak hiôk-hian gô tơl tơwih nơ̆r Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n.

English: And I separated twelve of the leaders of the priests—Sherebiah, Hashabiah, and ten of their brethren with them
Bahnar: Lăm lu 'bok soi, inh rơih chă mơjĭt-'bar 'nu pơm yŏng kơdră, noh jơ̆ Sêrêbia, Hasabia păng mơjĭt 'nu 'nhŏng oh lu sư

English: and weighed out to them the silver, the gold, and the articles, the offering for the house of our God which the king and his counselors and his princes, and all Israel who were present, had offered.
Bahnar: đơ̆ng noh, inh kŏng ăn kơ lu sư, hu, maih păng lu tơmam hnam akŭm đe pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, tơmam noh đơ̆ng pơtao lu bơngai hơgei, lu 'bok kuan tih pơtao, hăm đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael tơ noh pơyơ̆r.

English: I weighed into their hand six hundred and fifty talents of silver, silver articles weighing one hundred talents, one hundred talents of gold
Bahnar: Thoi noh, inh kŏng pơjao ăn kơ lu sư đei tơdrâu-hrĕng pơđăm-jĭt talâng jên hu, tơmam yua pơm păng hu trăp sư minh-hrĕng talâng hlak jên hu păng đĭ minh-hrĕng talâng hlak jên maih

English: twenty gold basins worth a thousand drachmas, and two vessels of fine polished bronze, precious as gold.
Bahnar: 'bar-jĭt tŏ pơnhan maih tĕch sư noh minh-rơbâu đariêk păng 'bar tŏ pơnhan tô pơm păng kong rang 'lơ̆ng hloh, kư̆m gĭt thoi maih mơ̆n.

English: And I said to them, “You are holy to the LORD; the articles are holy also; and the silver and the gold are a freewill offering to the LORD God of your fathers.
Bahnar: Na inh khan kơ lu sư thoi âu: Lu iĕm jơ̆ bơngai 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Kră Yang păng lu tơmam yua lăm hnam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei noh kư̆m 'lơ̆ng rơgoh mơ̆n. Hu păng maih âu jơ̆ tơmam soi pơyơ̆r lăp đon Kră Yang Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'bok lu iĕm.

English: Watch and keep them until you weigh them before the leaders of the priests and the Levites and heads of the fathers’ houses of Israel in Jerusalem, in the chambers of the house of the LORD.”
Bahnar: Athei bơwei sư mă tơnen dĭng truh tơ layơ lu iĕm kŏng dơ̆ng jao ăn 'bơ̆t anăp đe 'bok soi păng bơngai Lêwi, hăm 'bơ̆t anăp lu kơdră adrĕch adrung đe Isơrael tơ pơlei Jêrusalem, lăm hnam mong tơmam hnam akŭm Kră Yang.

English: So the priests and the Levites received the silver and the gold and the articles by weight, to bring them to Jerusalem to the house of our God.
Bahnar: Thoi noh lu 'bok soi păng lu bơngai Lêwi, đơ̆ng rŏng kơ lu sư đei kŏng lăng lu hu, maih păng lu tơmam yua lăm hnam noh đang boih, na akŭm pơpôi iŏk na chĕp ba tơ pơlei Jêrusalem, tah lăm hnam akŭm kơkuh kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n.

English: Then we departed from the river of Ahava on the twelfth day of the first month, to go to Jerusalem. And the hand of our God was upon us, and He delivered us from the hand of the enemy and from ambush along the road.
Bahnar: Năr mơjĭt-'bar khei mônh, lu nhôn pơtơm yak năm đơ̆ng đak krong Ahawa, wă năm tơ pơlei Jêrusalem. Ti Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei nhôn gô tơgŭm, dŏng pơklaih nhôn đơ̆ng ti lu ayăt, lu bơngai răp trong.

English: So we came to Jerusalem, and stayed there three days.
Bahnar: Na, nhôn truh tơ pơlei Jêrusalem, oei pơdơh tơ noh pêng năr.

English: Now on the fourth day the silver and the gold and the articles were weighed in the house of our God by the hand of Meremoth the son of Uriah the priest, and with him was Eleazar the son of Phinehas; with them were the Levites, Jozabad the son of Jeshua and Noadiah the son of Binnui
Bahnar: Năr mă puăn, lu nhôn kŏng lăng dơ̆ng lu hu, maih păng lu tơmam yua lăm hnam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, đơ̆ng noh pơjao ăn kơ Mêrêmôt, kon drŏ-nglo 'bok soi Uri, 'bok soi hơdai hăm sư đei Êlêasar, kon drŏ-nglo Phinêhas, Jôsabat kon drŏ-nglo Jêsua păng Nôađia, kon drŏ-nglo Binnui, bơngai Lêwi.

English: with the number and weight of everything. All the weight was written down at that time.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng tơmam đei kŏng lăng hơlen, trăp dôm yơ chih răk hơđăl dôm noh.

English: The children of those who had been carried away captive, who had come from the captivity, offered burnt offerings to the God of Israel: twelve bulls for all Israel, ninety-six rams, seventy-seven lambs, and twelve male goats as a sin offering. All this was a burnt offering to the LORD.
Bahnar: Lu nhôn bơngai mă đe rôp pơm bơnă gơh wih brŏk dơ̆ng, pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh ăn kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đe Isơrael đĭ mơjĭt-'bar tŏ rơmo dăm đơ̆ng lăm mơjĭt-'bar adrĕch Isơrael, tơsĭn-jĭt tơdrâu tŏ triu dăm, tơpơh-jĭt tơpơh tŏ triu kon păng mơjĭt-'bar tŏ bơbe dăm wă pơm tơmam soi huai iŏk tơdrong yoch; đĭ-đăng pơm tơmam soi 'buh pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang.

English: And they delivered the king’s orders to the king’s satraps and the governors in the region beyond the River. So they gave support to the people and the house of God.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơjao hla bơar nơ̆r tơtă đơ̆ng pơtao ăn kơ lu 'bok kuan wei tơring păng ăn kơ lu 'bok kuan wei pơgơ̆r char gah bơmơ̆t đak krong, na lu sư tơgŭm kon pơlei păng tơdrong jang hnam akŭm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: When these things were done, the leaders came to me, saying, “The people of Israel and the priests and the Levites have not separated themselves from the peoples of the lands, with respect to the abominations of the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Jebusites, the Ammonites, the Moabites, the Egyptians, and the Amorites.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ tơdrong noh, lu 'bok kuan tih năm jê̆ pơma hăm inh thoi âu: Kon pơlei Isơrael, lu 'bok soi păng bơngai Lêwi hai, ưh kơ đei tơklah đơ̆ng adrĕch păng lăm tơring âu, lu sư pơm rok lu kon pơlei Kanaan, kon pơlei Hêtit, kon pơlei Phêrêsit, kon pơlei Jêbus, kon pơlei Ammôn, kon pơlei Môap, kon pơlei Êyiptơ păng kon pơlei Amôrit.

English: For they have taken some of their daughters as wives for themselves and their sons, so that the holy seed is mixed with the peoples of those lands. Indeed, the hand of the leaders and rulers has been foremost in this trespass.”
Bahnar: Yua kơ lu sư rôp oei kơ lu drŏ-kăn bơngai tơmoi păng kư̆m rôp ăn kon drŏ-nglo lu sư oei na lu adrĕch 'lơ̆ng rơgoh jing hrâu hre hăm adrĕch lăm dêh âu; tơpă lu đe kơdră păng 'bok kuan wei-lăng kon pơlei pơm yoch adrol hloh.

English: So when I heard this thing, I tore my garment and my robe, and plucked out some of the hair of my head and beard, and sat down astonished.
Bahnar: Kơtơ̆ng lu nơ̆r noh, na inh hek ao lăm păng ao 'nguaih inh, buch sŏk kơ̆l păng sŏk kang, na hơ-oei ơh sơ'ngon.

English: Then everyone who trembled at the words of the God of Israel assembled to me, because of the transgression of those who had been carried away captive, and I sat astonished until the evening sacrifice.
Bahnar: Đei lu bơngai băt chu yom nơ̆r Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đe Isơrael pơma lu sư akŭm tăp dăr kơ inh, lu sư hli kơ tơdrong yoch tih mă lu bơngai 'nao wih brŏk đơ̆ng pơm bơnă đei pơm yoch noh, gah inh ngôi hơ-oei hli tơtơ̆ dĭng truh tơ đei pơyơ̆r tơmam soi kiơ̆ kơsơ̆.

English: At the evening sacrifice I arose from my fasting; and having torn my garment and my robe, I fell on my knees and spread out my hands to the LORD my God.
Bahnar: Truh tơ jơ pơyơ̆r tơmam soi kơsơ̆, inh iung đơ̆ng anih jơhngơ̆m mơlâu ơh sơ'ngon; ao lăm păng ao đaih inh hek hiah đĭ; inh hơtơ̆p kŭl-tăng, inh yơ̆r ti gah Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh

English: And I said: “O my God, I am too ashamed and humiliated to lift up my face to You, my God; for our iniquities have risen higher than our heads, and our guilt has grown up to the heavens.
Bahnar: na krao apinh thoi âu: “Ơ, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh! Inh kơdơ̆ mơlâu dêh, ưh kơ pơ̆n ngơk lăng muh măt tơ Ih, Ih boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh; yua kơ tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ lu nhôn pơm kơjung hloh kơ kơ̆l lu nhôn păng tơdrong yoch lu nhôn pơm kơjung truh tơ plĕnh.

English: Since the days of our fathers to this day we have been very guilty, and for our iniquities we, our kings, and our priests have been delivered into the hand of the kings of the lands, to the sword, to captivity, to plunder, and to humiliation, as it is this day.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng chăl 'bok yă lu nhôn truh tơ dang ei, lu nhôn đei pơm yoch tih kơnê̆ tơpă, kơlih kơ tơdrong yoch lu nhôn, kơdih akâu lu nhôn, lu pơtao lu 'bok soi lu nhôn, Ih jao boih lăm tơpang ti lu pơtao dêh nai, pơlôch pơmat lu nhôn, tơgar iŏk tơmam păng pơm pơ'brơh, nhen thoi dang ei.

English: And now for a little while grace has been shown from the LORD our God, to leave us a remnant to escape, and to give us a peg in His holy place, that our God may enlighten our eyes and give us a measure of revival in our bondage.
Bahnar: Mă-lei dang ei lăm minh kơchon kơđeh đĕch Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu nhôn đei pơdah boih tơdrong mơnat wă tơgŭm lu nhôn bơngai oei oăi arih brŏk tơ dêh 'lơ̆ng rơgoh păng ăn kơ lu nhôn minh anih kơjăp lăm anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Sư; wă kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu nhôn pơchrang ăn kơ măt lu nhôn păng ăn kơ lu nhôn hơdah oei arih 'biơ̆ tŏ sĕt kơplah lu nhôn jing đĭch đam đe.

English: For we were slaves. Yet our God did not forsake us in our bondage; but He extended mercy to us in the sight of the kings of Persia, to revive us, to repair the house of our God, to rebuild its ruins, and to give us a wall in Judah and Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Yua kơ lu nhôn tơm hmơm sơ̆ jĭ bơngai pơm đĭch; mă-lei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei nhôn ưh kơ đei achăng lê̆ lu nhôn kơplah oei pơm đĭch sơ̆, Sư ăn kơ nhôn tơdrong Sư 'mêm sĭt 'bơ̆t anăp pơtao Phersia, wă ăn kơ lu nhôn arih 'biơ̆ wă kơ gơh pơm hnam akŭm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu nhôn păng wă kơ wih pơm ming đêl pơchah răm, kư̆m ăn kơ lu nhôn minh anih oei kơjăp lăm dêh Juđa păng pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: And now, O our God, what shall we say after this? For we have forsaken Your commandments
Bahnar: Dang ei, ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu nhôn! Nhôn wă gơh pơma kiơ dơ̆ng yua kơ tơdrong truh boih? Yua kơ lu nhôn đei sơngah boih kơ nơ̆r Ih tơtă.

English: which You commanded by Your servants the prophets, saying, ‘The land which you are entering to possess is an unclean land, with the uncleanness of the peoples of the lands, with their abominations which have filled it from one end to another with their impurity.
Bahnar: Ih đei tơtă kơ lu 'bok khan lê̆ adrol, đĭch đam Ih, khan kơ lu nhôn: Dêh char mă lu iĕm wă mơ̆t iŏk noh, jơ̆ minh pôm dêh 'mê̆-'mach, yua kơ đơ̆ng kon pơlei oei tơ noh pơm yoch boih păng đơ̆ng tơdrong lu sư kơkuh kơ yang mă Inh areh tơ jơ̆p-jang kơ dêh noh đơ̆ng pah âu truh tơ pah to.

English: Now therefore, do not give your daughters as wives for their sons, nor take their daughters to your sons; and never seek their peace or prosperity, that you may be strong and eat the good of the land, and leave it as an inheritance to your children forever.’
Bahnar: Kơlih kơ thoi noh, na 'nĕ ăn kon adruh lu iĕm iŏk kon tơdăm lu sư păng kư̆m 'nĕ ăn kon tơdăm lu iĕm iŏk kon adruh lu sư; 'nĕ kơ layơ chă tơdrong hiôk-hian lu sư păng wă kơ chă đei jing mơdrŏng đơ̆ng lu sư, wă kơ lu iĕm jing nuih pran, sŏng sa yua tơmam 'lơ̆ng đơ̆ng lăm dêh char păng 'măn lê̆ kơ kon lu iĕm dêh char âu jing tơmam lu sư yua ling-lang ling-lang hloi.

English: And after all that has come upon us for our evil deeds and for our great guilt, since You our God have punished us less than our iniquities deserve, and have given us such deliverance as this
Bahnar: Na đơ̆ng rŏng kơ tơdrong truh phak lu nhôn, noh yua kơ đơ̆ng tơdrong lu nhôn pơm yoch tih dêh, Ih 'bôh ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu nhôn! Tơpă Ih ưh kơ wă phak lu nhôn trŏ thoi tơdrong yoch lu nhôn đei pơm ôh păng ăn kơ lu nhôn oei klaih klăi thoi âu

English: should we again break Your commandments, and join in marriage with the people committing these abominations? Would You not be angry with us until You had consumed us, so that there would be no remnant or survivor?
Bahnar: Thoi noh na liơ nhôn wă pơm yoch kơ khôi juăt Ih dơ̆ng lĕ, oei iŏk klo kăn hăm lu adrĕch adrung mă oei kơkuh tơdrong kơnê̆ dah kiơ? Hăm trŏ ih gô hil mĭl, Ih gô pơrăm lu nhôn, truh tơ mah pă đei bu oei arih, ưh kơ đei bu gơh klaih dah kiơ?

English: O LORD God of Israel, You are righteous, for we are left as a remnant, as it is this day. Here we are before You, in our guilt, though no one can stand before You because of this!”
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đe Isơrael! Ih boih tơm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt; yua kơ lu nhôn, mă oei arih gơh klaih, thoi đei 'bôh dang ei; 'nâu lu nhôn oei 'bơ̆t anăp Ih, pơm lơ tơdrong yoch; yua kơ noh, ưh kơ đei bu kĕ dơ̆ng ôh 'bơ̆t anăp Ih.”

English: Now while Ezra was praying, and while he was confessing, weeping, and bowing down before the house of God, a very large assembly of men, women, and children gathered to him from Israel; for the people wept very bitterly.
Bahnar: Lăm kơplah Esơra krao khan tơbral, nhơ̆m hmoi, roi tơbral yoch păng drap 'bơ̆t anăp hnam akŭm, na đei minh tơpôl kon pơlei Isơrael, bơngai drŏ-kăn drŏ-nglo hơ'lơ̆p lơ dêh, akŭm tăp dăr kơ sư; lu sư kư̆m nhơ̆m hmoi ơh ol.

English: And Shechaniah the son of Jehiel, one of the sons of Elam, spoke up and said to Ezra, “We have trespassed against our God, and have taken pagan wives from the peoples of the land; yet now there is hope in Israel in spite of this.
Bahnar: Sêkania kon drŏ-nglo Jêhiêl, lu kon sâu Êlam sư khan kơ Esơra thoi âu; lu nhôn đei pơm yoch hăm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n na iŏk oei boih kơ lu kon drŏ-kăn bơngai tơmoi adrĕch adrung lăm dêh 'nâu; mă khan lu nhôn đei pơm thoi noh ră, kư̆m oei đei tơdrong hơmĕng mă wă ăn kơ đe Isơrael.

English: Now therefore, let us make a covenant with our God to put away all these wives and those who have been born to them, according to the advice of my master and of those who tremble at the commandment of our God; and let it be done according to the law.
Bahnar: Na dang ei, nhôn athei pơkăm pơkă hăm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei nhôn wă hrĕch achăng păng lê̆ đĭ lu drŏ-kăn noh păng đĭ-đăng lu kon hơ'lơ̆p lu sư, kiơ̆ ih păng lu bơngai băt hli yom pơm kiơ̆ khôi juăt Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei bơtho khan; athei pơm kiơ̆ bĕ khôi juăt.

English: Arise, for this matter is your responsibility. We also are with you. Be of good courage, and do it.”
Bahnar: Ih athei iung bĕ, yua kơ tơdrong âu 'bơm hăm ih păng lu nhôn gô tơgŭm; ih athei đei jơhngơ̆m pơ̆n nuih na pơm tơdrong 'nâu.

English: Then Ezra arose, and made the leaders of the priests, the Levites, and all Israel swear an oath that they would do according to this word. So they swore an oath.
Bahnar: Esơra sư iung, apinh lu 'bok soi păng bơngai Lêwi hăm đĭ-đăng Isơrael pơkăm pơkă pơm kiơ̆ thoi ei, lu sư pơkăm hloi.

English: Then Ezra rose up from before the house of God, and went into the chamber of Jehohanan the son of Eliashib; and when he came there, he ate no bread and drank no water, for he mourned because of the guilt of those from the captivity.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh Esơra iung weh đơ̆ng anih 'bơ̆t anăp lăm hnam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, na mơ̆t lăm anih Jêhôhanan, kon drŏ-nglo Êliasip; sư mơ̆t 'bĭch kơmăng tơ noh ưh kơ đei sŏng sa păng nhă đak ôh, yua kơ sư ơh sơ'ngon, yua kơ tơdrong yoch đe kon pơlei mă đe đei rôp pơm bơnă mă đei wih brŏk.

English: And they issued a proclamation throughout Judah and Jerusalem to all the descendants of the captivity, that they must gather at Jerusalem
Bahnar: Na đe ră roi kơ jơ̆p-jang kơ dêh Juđa păng pơlei Jêrusalem, krao đĭ-đăng lu kon pơlei đêl đe rôp pơm bơnă gơh wih brŏk, athei lu sư năm pơpôi akŭm tơ pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: and that whoever would not come within three days, according to the instructions of the leaders and elders, all his property would be confiscated, and he himself would be separated from the assembly of those from the captivity.
Bahnar: Lăm pêng năr, bơngai bu ưh kơ năm kiơ̆ thoi 'bok kuan tih păng đe kră tơtă, na mŭk tơmam sư noh đe gô pơdrâu iŏk pơđĭ, bơngai noh đe gô puh tơweh, kiơ̆ thoi lu kră păng lu bơngai pơgơ̆r ưh kơ ăn kơ sư akŭm hơdai kon pơlei mă 'nao brŏk dơ̆ng đơ̆ng pơm bơnă.

English: So all the men of Judah and Benjamin gathered at Jerusalem within three days. It was the ninth month, on the twentieth of the month; and all the people sat in the open square of the house of God, trembling because of this matter and because of heavy rain.
Bahnar: Lăm pêng năr, đĭ-đăng bơngai drŏ-nglo Juđa, Bênjamin, đĭ-đăng năm akŭm tơ pơlei Jêrusalem, 'blep kơ năr 'bar-jĭt khei tơsĭn; đĭ-đăng kon bơngai hơ-oei cham să 'bơ̆t anăp lăm hnam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, hli tơrơ yua kơ tơdrong 'nâu păng yua kơ tơdrong 'mi tih.

English: Then Ezra the priest stood up and said to them, “You have transgressed and have taken pagan wives, adding to the guilt of Israel.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh, Esơra, 'bok soi, sư iung păng khan kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai: Lu iĕm đei pơm yoch, iŏk oei kơ lu drŏ-kăn tơmoi, tơdrong yoch 'nâu pơthim lơ tơdrong yoch kơ bơngai Isơrael.

English: Now therefore, make confession to the LORD God of your fathers, and do His will; separate yourselves from the peoples of the land, and from the pagan wives.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh dang ei, tơbral bĕ tơdrong yoch iĕm kơ Kră Yang Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'bok lu iĕm păng pơm kiơ̆ kơ Sư lăp đon; athei weh bĕ đơ̆ng lu adrĕch tơmoi lăm dêh âu păng đơ̆ng lu bơngai tơmoi mă lu iĕm iŏk pơm akăn.

English: Then all the assembly answered and said with a loud voice, “Yes! As you have said, so we must do.
